Transcript:
W: I apologize for being late to work. Q1 The parking lot on Swan street was closed for some reason. I think they are moving to another location.
M: I understand. Q1 Most of the staff were late because of this issue. Where did you find a parking space? On Franklin Avenue?
W: Yeah. There was some parking on Franklin Avenue. So I parked there. Q2 The sign on Swan Street said I could not park there after nine o’clock in the morning.
M: That’s a good idea. Franklin Avenue has parking until ten o’clock.
W: Q3 I suggest you take the bus tomorrow; it took me thirty minutes to walk to the office from Franklin Avenue.

question.text: According to the man, why are people arriving late to work?
choices: (A) Swan Street parking lot was closed.
(B) The Franklin Avenue parking lot was closed.

answer.text: (A) Swan Street parking lot was closed.

answer.explanation:
M: Hi, Ms. Parker? This is Joseph sterling from Green Creek Realtors. We need to talk about an issue with the apartment you wanted.
W: Oh, hi Joseph. Did you manage to find me a place in the Kahlua Apartment building?
M: Yes, that’s the reason I’m calling. But there is a bit of an issue.
W: Really? What is it?
M: There is a major pest problem in the building, and they need to clear the whole building and carry out pest control. It’s going to take them at least three months to make sure the building is clean. So you would have to wait three months to get a place there...
W: I see...
M: There is a building just nearby called Graceville Towers. It’s very close to the Kahlua building so you could stay there for three months then move over to the Kahlua building. I will arrange ail of the moving for you. Why don’t you go online and check out Graceville Towers and get back to me?
W: Sure, that sounds good. Thanks Joseph.

question.text: What is the reason for Joseph’s call?
choices: (A) There is a problem with the apartment.
(B) To sign the contract for the apartment
(D) To discuss the price of rent

answer.text: (A) There is a problem with the apartment.

question.text: What does Joseph say about the Kahlua Apartment?
choices: (A) It’s ready to move in anytime.
(C) It is near a new fitness center.
(D) There is a major pest problem.

answer.text: (D) There is a major pest problem.

question.text: What does Joseph offer to do?
choices: (A) Find a new apartment at Graceville Towers
(D) Move into the Kahlua Apartment building

answer.explanation: Hello everyone. Q1 I wanted to get you together to go over the recent failures in our customer service department here at Monster Telecom. As you know, customer service Is at the heart of everything we do. We receive on average 3,000 calls per week from customers with a wide range of needs. Q2 In order to prepare you all to handle the most frequently asked questions from our customers, I have distributed the graph in front of you. Please go over this graph with your team leader and develop a plan to improve our customer service. Next quarter’s reviews will be in two months. Q3 We aim to have half as many weekly calls by then.

choices: (A) They are having customer service problems.
(B) There are too many calls for the number of employees.

answer.text: (A) They are having customer service problems.

answer.text: (A) How to deal with customers being upset by overcharges

(D) Reduce the number of customer calls they receive by 50%

answer.text: (D) Reduce the number of customer calls they receive by 50%

question.text:
GRANGE RIVER TOWER DIRECTORY
Extension Name
3rd Floor Corporate Suited
4th Floor Rosella Ballroom
5th Floor Gloria Westwood Ballroom
6th Floor Main office

answer.explanation: Hi, everybody. Welcome to the retirement celebration of our long time president Mr. Jang. Mr. Jang has served as president for the last 22 years and has helped build our business from its humble beginnings to a fortune 500 company. It’s a pleasure to host this special event in the famous Gloria Westwood Ballroom. I consider it an indication of the success we have experienced. My name is Bob Hopkins, and I’ve worked with Mr. Jang for over 20 years. I consider him to be one of the most talented, honest, and hardworking people I know and I feel privileged to call him my friend. So, with no further ado, please put your hands together for Mr. Jang.

question.text: What is the topic of this week’s podcast?
What does the speaker say will take place next month?
Why does the speaker say, “That’ll only take a minute”?
The new furniture for the conference room is scheduled to be delivered _____ on Tuesday.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> C

question.text: You’ll find the ink cartridges___the top shelf of the closet.

answer.explanation: (B) On is used in this sentence to mean “on top of”. Choice (A) means “inside of”. Choice (C) is not a preposition of place. Choice (D) cannot be used in this context.

question.text: The upscale boutique Jane’s Closet is known for selling the most stylish _____  for young professionals.

answer.explanation:
The missing position is after an adjective, we need to add a noun
=> Choose A

question.text: The study showed that customers aged 35 to 44 paid with a Sonoka credit _____than customers in any other age-group.

answer.explanation: Need a comparative structure=> choose C

question.text: ___we paid the painters a lot of money, they did a terrible job.

answer.explanation: (C) “Although” shows a contrast between the two clauses. Choices (A) and (B) are used to show a cause-and-effect relationship. Choice (D) is normally followed by a noun, not by a clause.

question.text: At the end of the year, the company puts ___ a picnic for the employees.

answer.explanation: (D) “Put on” is a two-word verb that in this context means to “produce”. The other prepositions in Choices (A), (B), and (C) do not fit the context of the sentence.

question.text: Hiring an……………………for Ms. Tsai must be our top priority, as her workload has increased.

answer.explanation:
Need to fill in a noun after the article "an"
=> answers A, C are verbs. => wrong
- For answers B, C, based on the meaning of the word to select the correct answer=> B

question.text: Sales ______ unavailable to take your call at the moment will call you back as soon as possible.

answer.explanation: The position to be filled after a noun and be the subject of the sentence. So, the missing word will be a noun to form the compound noun as the subject of the sentence.

question.text: The LPN auto company has issued a special report to address concerns _____  the fuel efficiency of its vehicles.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: Because the weather was warmer than usual this summer, the crops  _____  a few weeks early.

answer.explanation:
Based on the hint "a few weeks early"
=> Choose D

question.text: In light of our recent expansion, it will be  ______ to hire another administrative assistant by June 1.

answer.explanation: Choose an adjective after “be” and go with “to V” after it.

question.text: Following Ms. Rivera’s _____ statement, the official awards ceremony for Plex Industries will commence.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words =>Choose A
- Brief statement

question.text: It is essential that the logo for Prime Vitamins be integrated  _____  all of its catalogs and mailings.

answer.explanation:
integrate into
=> Choose A

question.text: If your flight is delayed, ___ the airport.

answer.explanation: (C) Use the simple form for a command. Choice (A) is a gerund. Choice (B) is future tense. Choice (D) is past tense.

question.text: Ms. Pieraccini had ___ finished editing the budget report when she noticed an error In the title page.

answer.explanation:
Nearly = Almost
"Nearly" is the only answer that comes before verbs.

question.text: Although the team members ………………… were not available after the game, the coach was happy to be interviewed.

answer.explanation:
- Because the sentence has the subject "team members" , we eliminate answer B.
- The sentence has no nouns that indicate 'possessive in the front, so cannot choose possessive pronoun, => eliminate answer C.
- "them" is an object, not suitable after the subject "team members", eliminate answer D.
=> Need to choose the reflexive pronoun "themselves".

question.text: Construction of the Yukimura Building______  because of modifications in the architectural plans.

answer.explanation: Use present perfect

question.text: The mayor's office is expected to ___ a press release tomorrow morning regarding the city's new building ordinance.

answer.explanation:
Issue st = Make st known (formal)
Issue a statement/press release

question.text: We decided not to rent that office because it was not very___.

answer.explanation: (C) This is an adjective used to describe the noun “office”. Choice (A) is a noun or a verb. Choice (B) is a past tense verb. Choice (D) is a noun.

question.text: The updated training program is limited to site supervisors _____ the Casey Medical Care system.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> A

question.text: The National Overview is the fourth  ______ distributed newspaper in the northeastern region.

answer.explanation: After the blank is distributed (adjective), before that is "the", so the space to fill should be an adverb and in the superlative form.

question.text: The size of private tours of the old castle will be limited_____  ten people.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose A

question.text: Ms. Yasuda's ___ in managing difficult projects has earned her respect from colleagues and company officials.

answer.explanation: The answer comes after "Ms. Yasuda's" so we use a noun.

question.text: A computer is ___  than a typewriter.

answer.explanation: (A) A comparison of two things uses “more + adjective” or the “-er” form. Choices (B) and (C) use “most”. Choice (D) uses “the”.

question.text: Three Across the World, a documentary film ------- forest diversity, won a top prize at the arts festival.

answer.explanation: Use active reduction clauses

question.text: The rear seats in the new Omaha Motors family car can be folded ___.

answer.explanation: The answer refers to position so we choose "forward".

question.text: Sales of domestically built cars dropped by 10.2 percent in December, reflecting somewhat ___ demand than expected.

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the noun "demand" so we use an adjective. However, because there is the word "than" so we need a comparative adjective.

question.text: Your Polytonics e-mail account will be set up ------- you arrive on your first day.

answer.explanation: Need to fill in the appropriate conjunction

question.text: The nasal spray allowed Bert to keep his seasonal allergies ______ control without having to get a prescription.

answer.explanation:
under control: being dealt with or limited successfully
=> Choose B

question.text: Please make a note ___ your customer and receipt numbers in case you need to contact us about your order,

answer.explanation: Make a note of = Write down/Remember

question.text:
Employee Message Board
Holiday Office Party’s Success and Appreciation
Posted by Julie Norton

I want to thank everyone who (1) _____ make this party a success. (2) _____. We had some ups and downs as we started preparing for this but the final result has been extraordinary. In fact, the (3) _____ consensus seems to be that this year’s party was the best yet. We had the highest turnout ever and many seem to agree that this year’s activities contributed to the party’s success. It was a joy to see everyone get along so well and participate in all the events. We even (4) _____ our children’s charity fundraising goals by over $1000. Once again, I would like to thank everyone.
I want to thank everyone who (1) _____ make this party a success.

answer.explanation: This sentence indicates a completed action => use past simple

question.text: (2) _____. We had some ups and downs as we started preparing for this but the final result has been extraordinary.
choices: (A) I really enjoyed all the food and chatting with everyone.
(B) I worked really hard to plan this event.
(C) Special thanks to Keith, Grant, Vanessa, and Melissa, who spent many hours outside of work to help plan everything.
(D) I’m glad to see that everyone made it to work today.

answer.text: (C) Special thanks to Keith, Grant, Vanessa, and Melissa, who spent many hours outside of work to help plan everything.
answer.explanation: The previous sentence mentions that "I want to thank everyone..." so C is correct

question.text: In fact, the (3) _____ consensus seems to be that this year’s party was the best yet.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text: We even (4) _____ our children’s charity fundraising goals by over $1000.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words. "exceeded our children’s charity fundraising goals by over $1000"

question.text:
E-Mail Message


To: Stephen Clayton stephen@claytongym.com
From: Amanda Palmer apalmer@linkedmail.net
Date: October 26
Subject: Fitness Center Membership

Dear Mr. Clayton,

This e-mail is in response to your letter of October 14, which stated that my membership at your fitness center will expire on October 31.1 wish to let you know that I have chosen not to renew it.

When I first became a member, the cost was 25 dollars per month. Now the cost is 50 dollars per month. Aside from this significant increase in cost, I have been dissatisfied with some of the services at the fitness center. There never seems to be enough equipment available for use at peak hours during the day. In addition, many of the new aerobics classes that I registered for were canceled due to low attendance.

Sincerely,
Amanda Palmer
Why did Ms. Palmer send the e-mail?
choices: (A)To explain why she will not renew her membership
(C)To ask for information about the center
(D)To report that a machine is not working

answer.text: (A)To explain why she will not renew her membership
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "This e-mail is in response to your letter of October 14, which stated that my membership at your fitness center will expire on October 31.1 wish to let you know that I have chosen not to renew it."

question.text: What is NOT one of Ms. Palmer’s concerns?

answer.explanation:
"There never seems to be enough equipment available for use at peak hours during the day." => Eliminate A
"In addition, many of the new aerobics classes that I registered for were canceled due to low attendance."=> Eliminate B
"When I first became a member, the cost was 25 dollars per month. Now the cost is 50 dollars per month. Aside from this significant increase in cost"=> Eliminate C

We would like to encourage all residents of Seattle to support their local communities by shopping at traditional local stores and markets.

question.text:
Warm Welcome & Special Thanks

(September 7) - Karinum Post readers may have noticed the addition of Mei Chandra to this newspaper's masthead. We are pleased to welcome her as our first-ever intern reporter at the paper.
Ms. Chandra recently moved to Jakarta after studying English and journalism in the United States. For her first assignment, she has researched the challenges currently faced by our country's textile industry from an international perspective. her initial article on this topic appears in this issue.
The addition of internships is just one more way we fulfill our educational mission. For the past year a half, the Karimum Post has been sustained primarily by funding from local academic institutions. The paper is now focused not only on keeping the local community informed but also on serving career-development purposes.
A bonus of this new direction for the paper is the number of students who now contribute to the publication in multiple ways. The editor would like to take this opportunity to thank the many students who volunteer their time each month - including those who deliver the print version of the newspaper to the doorsteps of our subscribers on time every week
What is stated about the intern position?
choices: (A) It is new to the publication.
(C) It is based on in the United States.
(D) It requires a degree in journalism.

answer.text: (A) It is new to the publication.
answer.explanation: Sign: "We are pleased to welcome her as our first-ever intern reporter at the paper"

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Chandra?

(C) She will help recruit more interns.
(D) She used to work in the textile industry.

answer.text: (B) She is writing a series of articles.
answer.explanation: Sign: "For her first assignment, she has researched the challenges currently faced by our country's textile industry from an international perspective. her initial article on this topic appears in this issue."

(C) It is printed in multiple languages.
(D) It is funded by advertising revenue.

answer.explanation: The editor would like to take this opportunity to thank the many students who volunteer their time each month

Business Hours in Early March

2:00-9:00 PM 2:00-8:00 PM 3:00-9:00 PM 4:00-9:00 PM 2:00-9:00 PM 2:00-10:00 PM 9:00 AM -6:00 PM

 

Due to the current construction on Shilling Street, we have been forced to revise our business hours for the first week in March (see the chart above.) Dubai Ecological Construction Expo

Exhibit Hall Rules

BADGE CONTROL

Admission to the exhibit hall is restricted to exhibitors from qualified companies, exposition attendees, and logistics personnel.

Badges are required on the floor at all limes, including during move-in and move-out days.
• Exhibitor badges will be given to the company’s primary contact for distribution to that exhibitor's personnel.
• The number of badges assigned to each exhibitor will be based on the size of booth space the company has rented.
• Anyone on the floor who is not officially registered will be evicted from the show.
• False certification of any individual as a company’s exhibition representative, or misuse of exhibitor badges, will be just cause for removing the exhibit from the floor.
What is the purpose of the policy statement?

(C) To specify who is permitted in the exhibit hall

Admission to the exhibit hall is restricted to exhibitors from qualified companies, exposition             

attendees, and logistics personnel.

question.text:
A Long-Lasting Love for Books

February 29 - Both in and around Pine Hill, Alfred Carlson，who has been teaching Russian literature at Pine Hill State University for twenty years, is probably best known as the owner of The Treasure Box, the town's oldest bookstore. The store has two unique features: it specializes in rare books and is open for business on Saturdays only. Evidently, walk-in sales make up only a small percentage of Mr. Carlson’s business; the bulk of the store’s revenue is generated by orders placed over the telephone or online by universities, museums, and private collectors.
On Sunday The Treasure Box will be celebrating its sixtieth anniversary. “When my mother, Willisa, opened the bookstore all those years ago on Green Edge Road, two blocks from here, she probably had no idea it would still be serving the public six decades later,” Mr. Carlson said. The store still displays the original sign over the doorway. The interior retains the living-room atmosphere it always had, with its mismatched tables and chairs. One section of the store is filled with books about baseball, an abiding passion of the Carlson family. On Friday nights the store becomes an informal social club. Not surprisingly, members tend to enjoy conversation about rare books, literature, and baseball.
Later this month Mr. Carlson will mark another milestone: he will be retiring from his teaching position. His retirement does not mean, however, that The Treasure Box will see extended business hours; it will continue to be open once a week. “I am not retiring from one job just so that I can spend more time on another,” Mr. Carlson said. “Rather, the fact that I no longer will have to prepare for classes or grade students’ papers means that I will be able to dedicate more time to my children and grandchildren.”
Why most likely was the article written?
choices: (A) To attract members to a new book club
(B) To highlight the benefits of selling items that are unique
(C) To celebrate the achievements of a local business personality
(D) To announce the relocation of an established business

answer.text: (C) To celebrate the achievements of a local business personality
answer.explanation: You can see the passage mentions about The Treasure Box as an achievement of Alfred Carlson.

question.text: What is NOT suggested about Mr. Carlson?
choices: (A) He will soon be ending his career as an instructor.
(B) He studies works written by Russian authors.
(C) He has lived in Pine Hill for almost ten years.
(D) He enjoys talking about baseball with others.

answer.text: (C) He has lived in Pine Hill for almost ten years.
answer.explanation:
(A) - Later this month Mr. Carlson will mark another milestone: he will be retiring from his teaching position.
(B) - Both in and around Pine Hill, Alfred Carlson，who has been teaching Russian literature at Pine Hill State University
(D) - One section of the store is filled with books about baseball, an abiding passion of the Carlson family. On Friday nights the store becomes an informal social club. Not surprisingly, members tend to enjoy conversation about rare books, literature, and baseball.

question.text: The word “retains” in paragraph 2, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: retain:to keep or continue to have something

question.text: What is stated about The Treasure Box?
choices: (A) It will be adding a section devoted to children’s books.
(B) It will maintain its current hours of operation.
(C) Its sales are expected to increase this year.
(D) Its sign will be replaced later in the month.

answer.text: (B) It will maintain its current hours of operation.
answer.explanation: The information is in: “The Treasure Box will see extended business hours; it will continue to be open once a week

Carlos Sanchez always had the dream of owning his own car dealership ever
since he started working as an assistant in an auto repair shop. Sanchez Motors carries all kinds of vehicles, from sports cars and vans to SUVs and trucks. Not sure what car fits your needs? Then come on down and try driving a variety of vehicles to see what’s right for you.

Sanchez Motors is located off Highway 5, just outside of the town of Stockton. We are open 7 days a week, from 9:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. Don’t hesitate, and come pay US a visit!

question.text:
J&P Industries

1462 Swinton street

Cameron, GL 10288

March 29
Mr. Grant Lee
287 Silver Plains Road
Cameron, GL 18729

Dear Mr. Lee,
We thank you for your continued work and your dedication to your job at J&P Industries. -[1] - We are sending all employees information about the new changes that have been made to your health insurance benefits at our company. You will continue to be covered by the same insurance company, but because of the new state regulations that have been put forth, all employees must now undergo a basic medical check-up at a local clinic or hospital. This check-up will be covered by your health insurance, so you do not need to pay any extra fees and this by no means will affect the monthly insurance deductions. -[2] - Included in the envelope is the detailed information about the new medical program for employees.
The medical check-ups will include a blood test, urine test, eye test, height and weight measurements, hearing test, and chest X-rays. - [3] - Please make an appointment with a local clinic. You should have your results given to Karen Leigh at Human Resources by December 30th at the latest. If you fail to get a medical exam, then you may be subject to a fine up to $2000. - [4] - We thank you for your cooperation and hope you abide by the new changes.
If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact Karen at leighk@jpindustries.com.

Sincerely,
John Black
Executive Manager
J&P Industries
The term “subject to” at the end of the second paragraph is closest in meaning to:

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: What is the purpose of the letter?
choices: (A) To inform an employee about a mandatory exam
(B) To encourage employees to donate blood to the hospital
(C) To discuss the changes made to the health insurance coverage
(D) To advertise the services of a new clinic

answer.text: (A) To inform an employee about a mandatory exam
answer.explanation: The content of this letter is about the medical examination the employee will undergo if will not have to pay high fines.	(B) To encourage employees to donate blood

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“The appointments should take no longer than 30 minutes.

answer.explanation: In this sentence there is mention "appointment", can be understood here as "health appointment", so it is most suitable for the position [3] after talking about what to do during the appointment.

question.text: What did Mr. Black send with the letter?

answer.explanation: Information on location “Included in the envelope is the detailed information about the new medical program for employees.”

question.text:
Midcity Performing Arts Hall

Support the Midcity Performing Arts Hall in downtown Brenton by becoming a member. You can choose from the following membership plans:
General - For only $100, you can get a full-year membership to attend any two performing arts shows that have available seats in the D area of the theater.
Silver - For a fee of $200, you can attend any two performing arts shows that have available seats in the B area of the theater.
Gold - For a fee of $500, you will receive early alerts of popular programs with a ticket to any two performing arts shows with seats in the B area, and a guaranteed seat for any show of your choice within a one-year period in the front row section.
Diamond - For a fee of $1000, you will have exclusive access to signed autographs with performing arts stars, invitations to two exclusive pre-showings of popular programs, and a guaranteed seat for any show of your choice within a one-year period in the VIP section.
*Some restrictions may apply.
*Admissions to orchestral performances excluded

=============================

To:bates@midcityarthall.com
From:Alicia Norton
Date:January 16
Subject:Membership

Thank you for the e-mail about the Midcity Performing Arts Hall membership. I have attached a fee of $1000.1 was a general member last year and I enjoyed a couple of the musicals that were performed. I have become a theater enthusiast since the experience and I look forward to the benefits of the new membership plan.
By the way, the Art Hall has done a phenomenal job on the renovations to the building. I'm excited to come back this year.

===========================

@PS@/kstoeic/images/4448661_1564544782006.png@PE@

answer.explanation: In the email, Alica Norton said there was a $ 1000 fee attached. According to the advertisement, this is the diamond membership fee, so this is likely the type of member she bought the most.

question.text: What is meant by the expression “some restrictions may apply”?
choices: (A)Only certain people will be considered for membership.
(B)The membership plans may change without notice.
(C)Not all performances are available to members.

answer.text: (C)Not all performances are available to members.
answer.explanation: "some restrictions may apply", meaning a number of shows will be limited to members. So the most suitable answer is C.

question.text: When is a performance not free to members?

answer.explanation: In the note of the ad, “Admissions to orchestral performances excluded ”, means that members are not allowed to enter free symphonies. The scheduled symphony is scheduled for January.

question.text: What is suggested about the Midcity Performing Arts Hall?
choices: (B)It had some changes made to the building.
(C)It is a place popular among celebrities.

question.text:
Chocolatier's Pavilion Mobbed
BERLIN (15 AUGUST) — The International Food Expo kicked off earlier this week, and it quickly became clear which pavilions are attracting the most interest from attendees at the weeklong event. From the moment it opened, the pavilion featuring the Brazilian chocolatier Amo-Te has been overrun with enthusiastic visitors.
"We didn't expect to be so popular," remarked company Marketing Manager Andreas Gomes, who arrived at the expo just in time to see his company's artisanal confectioners explain the chocolate-making process to eager crowds. “ We drew so many visitors that I had to fly in five more employees from our headquarters in Brazil to staff our busy display area.”
Vintage products that Amo-Te no longer distributes to retailers have been released in limited quantities. One exclusively available at the Expo is the once-popular bar made from dried fruit and covered with dark chocolate. The company has reproduced this old favorite in a classic, retro-style wrapper.
“We were confident that our appeal to chocolate-lovers' sense of nostalgia would be welcome,” said Mr. Gomes, “but we never expected this kind of success!”
=================

=================
According to the article, what action did Mr. Gomes have to take?
choices: (C)  Bringing extra workers to the event
(D)  Shipping additional samples to staff at the expo

answer.text: (C)  Bringing extra workers to the event
answer.explanation: “We drew so many visitors that I had to fly in five more employees from our headquarters in Brazil to staff our busy display area.”

question.text: In the article, the word "drew” in paragraph 2, line 6, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: In the context of this article, it can be seen that the meaning of 3 options A, B, C is inappropriate. The word "drew" here means "attract, attract", the closest meaning to "attracted".

question.text: On what day did Mr. Gomes likely arrive at the expo?

answer.explanation: “remarked company Marketing Manager Andreas Gomes, who arrived at the expo just in time to see his company's artisanal confectioners explain the chocolate-making process to eager crowds."

answer.explanation: “One exclusively available at the Expo is the once-popular bar made from dried fruit and covered with dark chocolate”....“the legendary dried-fruit and dark-chocolate Carpatho”

answer.text: (B) It is not yet available in stores.
answer.explanation: “You can also sample the new Malayna, a bittersweet confection with hints of coconut, debuting in retail locations early next year.”

===============================
To: Frieda Zuckerman
From: Miles Sorrell
Date February 5
Subject: Logistical arrangements
Attachment: Photos
Dear Ms. Zuckerman:
I regret to inform you that Tyche Fine Carpets, the supplier we selected for the carpets in The Pavel Hotel’s lobby and lounge areas, will not have our chosen pattern available until alternative selections that I believe will work well with the décor. They are all made of the same material as the previous selection, and the prices are comparable.With the grand opening less than a month away. I need a decision from you as soon as possible. Even with this last-minute change, I am certain that The Pavel Hotel will provide the ambience we have set out to create.
Thank you, Miles Sorrell.
===============================

Pavel Hotel Open by Lavonne Coe(Centerville—March 2) Former City court judge Mildred Simpson joined owner Patrice Snell yesterday to celebrate the opening of The Pavel Hotel in downtown Centerville, between the library and the visitors center. Once the city’s courthouse and Ms. Simpson’s workplace, the existing structure had been vacant for the past nine years. Now the space boasts 34 elegant rooms, an inviting lounge with a fireplace, and a gorgeous lobby. An on-site café is expected to open next month. The interior, designed by Miles Sorrell, retains the old features of the building, such as expansive windows and high ceilings, while creating a warm and inviting space.
What does the chart indicate about all the carpets in the Pleiades Collection?

answer.explanation: Lean on the board, look item shipping weights

question.text:
Next Month at the Belmont Historical Society

Documentary Film Night: "Exploring the Arctic"

May 5, Spruce Theater

Photo Exhibition: "America in the 20th Century"

Opening Night, May 9, Linda Cameron Art Gallery

Author Talk: Glen Campbell, "The Culture of Early America"

May 14, Chris Charlton Auditorium

Musical Performance: "American Folk Masters"

May 22, Spruce Theater


Children and seniors are allowed free entry to all events. Additionally, if you pay the registration fee and become a member of the Belmont Historical Society on our website, you can attend any event free of charge.
For questions about booking group visits, contact David Smith at dsmith@belmonthistoricalsociety.com. For more details regarding upcoming events and venue locations, or to rent one of our venues, visit us at www.belmonthistoricalsociety.com

=========================

To: David Smith dsmith@belmonthistoricalsociety.com
From:Jared Tate jtate@clarkuniversity.com
Date:April 22
Subject:Group Visit

Dear Mr. Smith,

Hello, my name is Jared Tate and I am a professor in the History Department at Clark University in downtown Maryville.
I am teaching an introductory history course for freshmen this semester, and I thought it would be helpful to attend the event featuring Mr. Campbell. His talk is very pertinent to the subjects we are currently covering in class.
I was also wondering if it would be possible to arrange a question-and-answer session between Mr. Campbell and my group of about 50 students. Please tell him that we are looking forward to seeing him.
I appreciate your reading my e-mail and I hope to hear back from you soon.

Jared Tate
History Department,
Clark University
What is indicated about the Belmont Historical Society?
choices: (A) It does not allow children into some events.
(B) It is run by the city of Belmont.
(C) It was founded by Linda Cameron.
(D) It will hold its events at several places.

answer.text: (D) It will hold its events at several places.
answer.explanation:
Eliminate A:  wrong information.

Eliminate B, C: no information.

Observe the information Belmont advertisement Historical Society will nest organizing events in different locations. => Choose D

question.text: What most likely is Mr. Tate currently teaching?

answer.explanation:
- “I am teaching an introductory history course for freshmen this semester, and I thougth it would be helpful to attend the event featuring Mr. Campbell ”.     

- "Author talk: Glen Campbell," The Culture of Early America "    
Mr. Tate is teaching history and at the next event Mr. Campbell speaks on the subject of "Early American History". -> Select B.

question.text: What is NOT mentioned as being available on the Belmont Historical Society website?

answer.explanation:
- “If you pay the registration fee and become a member of the Belmont Historical Society on our website, you can attend any event free of charge”.      

- “For more details regarding upcoming events and venue locations, or to rent one of our venues, visit us at www. belmonthistoricalsociety.com "
The information of options A, B, C is available on the website. Only option D is not available. -> Select D.

question.text: In the e-mail, the word “introductory” in paragraph 2, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: “I am teaching an introductory history course for freshmen this semester”.

question.text: What does Mr. Tate request?
choices: (A) A signed copy of a book
(C) A chance to meet a speaker

answer.text: (C) A chance to meet a speaker
answer.explanation: “I also wonder if it would be possible to arrange a question-and-answer session between Mr. Campbell and my group of about 50 students. Please tell him that we are looking forward to seeing him. ”

question.text:
http://www.positivohealth.com

Positivo Health Community

Welcome Membership Services Locations                  
Positivo Heath Community offers four types of gym memberships. All memberships include access to exercise machines, basketball and tennis court, and group exercise classes in all five of our Devenport locations. Additionally, each new member receives one free personal-training session.
Single ($35/month)
This membership includes basic access to our gym locations as described above.
Household ($30/month per person)
This membership includes basic access to our gym locations at a discounted rate for families of two or more individuals who join together.
Executive ($60/month)
In addition to basic access to our gym locations, executive membership includes access to our swimming pools and saunas.
Student ($25/month)
This membership offers basic access to our gym locations to local Provost University students who present valid student identification.



=============================

February 28
Dear Ron Mapleton,
Thank you for making Positivo Health Community a part of your total-body health program. It was so nice to meet you and your family when I showed you around our Davenport Central location in December.
We noticed that you have not yet taken advantage of your free hour of personal training. Each person on your account is entitled to one free session, but this perk expires three months after your contract is signed. Next week, the week of March 4, is the last week you will be able to use your free sessions. Please contact us today to schedule your personal-training sessions!
As a reminder, we offer one-on-one training for power yoga, Pilates, weight training, and power lifting. If you should choose to make personal training a regular part of your fitness routine, packages start at only $70 per month in addition to your monthly membership due.
Your partner in health,
Janie Park
Janie Park, Membership Manager

==========================

(C) Most of its members are students.

answer.text: (B) Its members can use multiple facilities.

question.text: What is indicated about Ms. Park?

(C) She creates weekly schedules for gym employees.
(D) She gave Mr. Mapleton a tour of the gym

answer.text: (D) She gave Mr. Mapleton a tour of the gym
answer.explanation: “It was so nice to meet you and your family when I showed you around our Davenport Central location in December”

question.text: In the letter, the word "packages" in paragraph 3, line 3, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "Package" here is understood as a service package, each package has its own exercise plan and benefits. In the given answers, there is a "plan" that means "plan, project", most suitable to replace "package" in this context.

question.text: What is probably true about Mr. Pinto?
choices: (A) He does not work on Fridays.
(C) He has not trained Mr. Mapleton before.
(D) He has requested a change to his schedule.

answer.text: (C) He has not trained Mr. Mapleton before.
answer.explanation: From the timeline of March 4-8, it can be seen that Mr. Mapleton went to the Power yoga class for the first session on March 6, but according to the email, Mr. Mapleton has not used his personal training session, and the week from March 4 is the last week prior to expiration. Thus, Mr. Mapleton's personal training session in this calendar can be inferred as his first, meaning that Mr. Pinto has never practiced for Mapleton before.
